identified-content.object.title: Advertising (Times Column)
identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Media, Entertainment and Publishing

abstract.p: Second annual Family Television Awards are presented by coalition of advertisers interested in stimulating production of prime-time television programs that appeal to broader multigenerational audiences (S)

block.p: The second annual Family Television Awards were presented last week by a coalition of advertisers that are interested in stimulating the production of prime-time television programs intended to appeal to broader multigenerational audiences.

The Family Friendly Programming Forum, composed of more than 40 major advertisers and supported by several large advertiser and agency trade associations, gave awards to the ''Biography'' series on the A & E cable network; ''Who Wants to Be a Millionaire'' on ABC; the movie ''Oprah Winfrey Presents: Tuesdays with Morrie'' on ABC; the comedy series ''Everybody Loves Raymond'' on CBS; ''National Geographic Explorer'' on the CNBC cable network; and the drama series ''The West Wing'' on NBC.

The second annual Family Television Awards were presented last week by a coalition of advertisers that are interested in stimulating the production of prime-time television programs intended to appeal to broader multigenerational audiences.

The Family Friendly Programming Forum, composed of more than 40 major advertisers and supported by several large advertiser and agency trade associations, gave awards to the ''Biography'' series on the A & E cable network; ''Who Wants to Be a Millionaire'' on ABC; the movie ''Oprah Winfrey Presents: Tuesdays with Morrie'' on ABC; the comedy series ''Everybody Loves Raymond'' on CBS; ''National Geographic Explorer'' on the CNBC cable network; and the drama series ''The West Wing'' on NBC.
In addition, Michael J. Fox and Della Reese were awards recognizing their acting achievement, and ''The Wonderful World of Disney'' on ABC received the lifetime achievement award.
The ceremony, filmed on Aug. 3 at the Beverly Hilton Hotel in Los Angeles, will be broadcast on CBS tonight at 9 p.m.
